content.question: Which of the following best describes the elementary step(s) in the reaction mechanism represented in the diagram above?

choices.label: One step: <math alttext="2 X gas plus Y gas produces X 2 Y gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>X</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>Y</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

One step: <math alttext="X 2 gas plus Y gas produces X 2 Y gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>Y</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

Two steps: Step 1: <math alttext="X gas plus Y gas produces X Y gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>XY</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> Step 2: <math alttext="X gas plus X Y gas produces X 2 Y gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>XY</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow><mtext></mtext><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

Two steps: Step 1: <math alttext="2 X gas produces X 2 gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>X</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> Step 2: <math alttext="X 2 gas plus Y gas produces X 2 Y gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>Y</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: Two steps: Step 1: <math alttext="2 X gas produces X 2 gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>X</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> Step 2: <math alttext="X 2 gas plus Y gas produces X 2 Y gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>Y</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 1.B: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate both particulate-level and macroscopic- level properties.
